stanza.line: Tis better to be vile than vile esteemedesteemed
When not to be receives reproach of beingbeing
And the just pleasure lost which is so deemeddeemed
Not by our feeling but by others seeingseeing
For why should others false adulterate eyeseyes
Give salutation to my sportive bloodblood
Or on my frailties why are frailer spiesspies
Which in their wills count bad what I think goodgood
No I am that I am and they that levellevel
At my abuses reckon up their ownown
I may be straight though they themselves be bevelbevel
By their rank thoughts my deeds must not be shownshown
Unless this general evil they maintainmaintain
All men are bad and in their badness reignreign
